author: yblue19
content: not sure which channel to ask so asking here - given high gas fee in mainnet, why do we still have blocks with 0 transactions? e.g. here https://etherscan.io/block/14007739

author: Deleted User
content: This is due to the base fee mechanism introduced in EIP-1599. The gas target is 15M gas per block. Before EIP-1599, in times of high demand the blocks would just simply float around that 15M gas target. After EIP-1599, there are 0M gas (=0 transactions) blocks, but also 30M gas (2x the gas target) blocks, which gives us an average of 15M gas per block.

content: Every bit of gas in your block means that it takes longer to process and propagate, increasing the chance that it will be an uncle

author: dcposch
content:
There have been empty blocks both before and after EIP 1559. 

Empty blocks are rare. I'm not clear on the exact mechanism, but in any case miners want to have all of their mining hardware searching for blocks at all times.

Most of the time a given mining rig has a valid tx root, but if not it defaults to an empty root and keeps searching for blocks.
